description: Adults reporting stricter childhood religious adherence remain more likely to actively practice a religion today.
estimand: Average marginal effect of childhood adherence (top vs. bottom tertile) on probability of currently practicing.
notes: Ordinal coding for externalreligion will be standardized before modeling.

description: Higher childhood class position predicts higher self-reported current net worth independent of current class identity.
population/subset: Respondents living in the United States with complete SES fields
estimand: Slope coefficient from ordered logit of networth on classchild controlling for covariates.
notes: Will verify whether networth levels form a strictly ordered scale.

description: Respondents who currently practice religion are less likely to identify as liberal, adjusting for age and education.
estimand: Average marginal effect of religion on probability of choosing the most liberal category.
notes: Requires confirmation that liberal is coded as ordinal 1-3.

description: Individuals raised with more siblings are more likely to report a stronger preference for monogamy.
population/subset: Full sample excluding extreme sibling counts (>10)
estimand: Linear trend (beta) of siblingnumber on monogamy preference score.
notes: Need to confirm monogamy coding direction before finalizing estimand.
